result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Robert Ewert

Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case rescheduled off the record.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Case set for a status conference on 9/2/22 at 1:30 pm. Defense counsel is unavailable and requests an adjournment. Case is rescheduled to 10/6/22 at 1:30 pm. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Christopher Robert Ewert in court.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Defendant advises he will be retaining private counsel. Court adjourns case. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Robert Ewert in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Defendant advises he will be retaining private counsel. Court adjourns case. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Robert Ewert in court.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court orders defendant to speak with 2-3 attorneys and bring list of income/expenses to the next court date. Court adjourns case to allow the defendant time to retain private counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JAE (dob 6/13/1989)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Christopher Robert Ewert in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Robert Ewert in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Robert Ewert appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT due to employment.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
